--- title: "Evaluating Personal Job Market Prospects in 2024" subtitle: "Final Report" author: - name: Sundarajan Swaminathan affiliations: - ref: bu affiliations: - id: bu name: Boston University city: Boston state: MA date: today format: docx: default --- --- title: "AI vs. Non-AI Job Growth: Is AI Taking Over or Creating More Jobs?" author: - "Sundarajan Swaminathan" date: "2025-02-18" format: html bibliography: references.bib csl: csl/econometrica.csl toc: true execute: echo: true --- **üåê Introduction: AI and the Future of Work** The rapid evolution of Artificial Intelligence (AI) is revolutionizing the global workforce‚Äîraising one big question: **üîç Is AI stealing jobs, or is it opening doors to entirely new careers?** As AI systems become more integrated into day-to-day operations‚Äîfrom automation in factories to algorithmic decision-making in finance‚Äîthe debate over job displacement versus job creation has intensified. This report investigates both sides of the AI impact equation: The risk of automation replacing traditional roles The emergence of high-growth, AI-powered careers In this pivotal moment, professionals across all industries must rethink their capabilities, stay agile with technological adoption, and proactively future-proof their skillsets. --- **üéØ Why This Study Matters in 2025** The fusion of AI and employment isn‚Äôt just a tech topic‚Äîit‚Äôs a global economic and societal concern. As of 2025, this intersection directly affects: ‚úÖ Employees ‚Äì Needing to continuously reskill and embrace lifelong learning ‚úÖ Employers ‚Äì Balancing automation with human capital strategies ‚úÖ Governments ‚Äì Designing policy to safeguard and reskill displaced workers ‚úÖ Students & Career Changers ‚Äì Navigating toward sustainable, future-proof roles **üî• Core Questions Explored:** Which jobs are most vulnerable to automation? What industries are booming due to AI? Do AI-powered roles offer higher pay and better growth? What actions must professionals take to remain relevant? These aren't hypothetical questions‚Äîthey are urgent priorities for a workforce navigating transformation. --- **ü§ñ AI: Job Disruptor and Creator** AI‚Äôs influence on employment is twofold‚Äîit both replaces and generates jobs. According to the World Economic Forum (2024): üîÅ 85 million jobs will be displaced by AI by 2025 ‚ûï But 97 million new roles will be created, many of which didn‚Äôt exist a decade ago ‚ö†Ô∏è Roles Most at Risk: üßæ Administrative & Clerical ‚Äì Data entry clerks, receptionists üõçÔ∏è Retail & Banking ‚Äì Cashiers, loan officers, bank tellers üè≠ Manufacturing ‚Äì Machine operators, assembly line staff **üöÄ Emerging AI-Powered Roles:** üß† AI/ML Engineers ‚Äì Developing intelligent algorithms üìä Data Scientists & Algorithmic Traders ‚Äì Deriving insights and driving automated decision-making üé® AI-Enhanced Creatives ‚Äì Using AI tools for design, copywriting, and content generation ‚öñÔ∏è AI Ethics & Policy Analysts ‚Äì Addressing ethical use and regulation of AI As AI transforms industries, digital literacy, analytical skills, and creativity will be more important than ever. --- **Report Structure: What You'll Learn** This study is structured into three practical sections designed for job seekers, professionals, educators, and policymakers: **1Ô∏è‚É£ Findings ‚Äì Understanding the Job Shift** Breakdown of job losses vs. creation across major sectors AI‚Äôs impact on finance, healthcare, manufacturing, and retail Comparison of salary trends in AI and Non-AI roles ‚û°Ô∏è Read the findings - ([findings.qmd](https://github.com/sundars96/ad688-employability-sp25A2-group2/blob/main/findings.qmd)) **2Ô∏è‚É£ Strategy ‚Äì Adapting to the AI Economy** Top AI skills in demand for 2024 and beyond Sectors with highest AI job creation potential Concrete career strategies to thrive amidst automation ‚û°Ô∏è Explore recommendations - ([career_strategy.qmd](https://github.com/sundars96/ad688-employability-sp25A2-group2/blob/main/career_strategy.qmd)) --- **Conclusion: Navigating the AI-Powered Job Market** AI isn‚Äôt just disrupting the world of work‚Äîit‚Äôs reshaping it. This transformation brings both uncertainty and opportunity. **üîé Key Takeaways:** AI will not eliminate human work‚Äîit will redefine it Upskilling and adaptability are the ultimate career insurance AI should be seen as a partner in productivity, not just a disruptor The future of work belongs to those who are prepared, proactive, and AI-aware. üìà Let‚Äôs move from fear to foresight‚Äîand embrace the new world of AI-powered careers. --- title: "Job Growth Trends & Strategy: A Comparative Look at AI and Non-AI Roles " authors: - Sundarajan Swaminathan --- # Career Strategies in the AI Era With the rapid evolution of AI, professionals must stay ahead by adopting future-ready strategies. This section outlines key approaches to sustaining career growth in an AI-driven job market. ## Key Strategies **1. Stay Updated with AI Regulations & Ethics** As AI adoption expands, professionals must remain informed about evolving policies, data privacy laws, and ethical automation practices. Insights from organizations like the IEEE Standards Association and OpenAI Policy Institute help track regulatory developments and ethical frameworks. Understanding AI bias mitigation and global compliance standards will be vital for businesses implementing AI at scale [@sciencedirect2024employment]. **2. Optimize Resumes for ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems)** With over 75% of companies using AI-powered ATS systems, making resumes AI-friendly is more important than ever. Focus on formatting for machine readability, using role-specific keywords, and avoiding over-designed templates. Tools like Jobscan and Resume Worded can help optimize your resume for higher visibility before submission [@umass2024ats]. **3. Adapt to Hybrid Work Environments** As AI reshapes remote and hybrid workflows, digital collaboration skills are now essential. Proficiency in tools like Slack, Zoom, and AI-integrated platforms such as Asana or Trello supports seamless hybrid operations. Leveraging AI-assisted scheduling and workflow automation increases both productivity and adaptability in flexible work settings [@weforum2024jobs]. **4. Upskill in AI & Data Science** The growing impact of AI across sectors demands expertise in machine learning, automation, and ethical AI deployment. Take advantage of programs like Google‚Äôs AI & ML certification, IBM‚Äôs AI Engineering course, or platforms like Udacity and LinkedIn Learning. Gaining hands-on experience with Python, TensorFlow, and AutoML will enhance your edge in a competitive AI-driven job market [@forbes2024future]. **5. Strengthen Human Skills** Despite AI advancements, skills like emotional intelligence, creativity, and critical thinking remain highly valued. Employers in AI-led industries prioritize leadership, problem-solving, and adaptability. Workshops, mentorships, and innovation bootcamps help sharpen these timeless competencies [@bizreport2024ai]. **6. Leverage Networking & Industry Connections** A significant 70%+ of job opportunities come through networking‚Äînot job boards. Build industry connections via AI-specific LinkedIn communities, forums, and live events like the Google AI Summit or MIT AI Research Meetups. Participating in hackathons and conferences fosters knowledge sharing and expands access to emerging roles [@elgar2024growth]. ## Comparison of AI & Non-AI Career Growth .....Aspect......... ||.........AI-Driven Careers..............||.....Traditional Careers..... Employment Outlook || Rapid expansion (97M jobs projected) || Steady but slower growth Skill Set || Emphasis on AI, ML, and Data Science || Focus on domain-specific expertise Compensation Trends || Elevated income potential || Consistent and stable pay Job Stability || Demands ongoing skill upgrades || Generally more secure roles Work Setting || Predominantly hybrid or remote || Primarily in-person work Dominant Sectors || Technology, Finance, Healthcare || Manufacturing, Retail --- --- title: "Findings ‚Äì AI's Impact on Job Growth" bibliography: references.bib csl: csl/econometrica.csl toc: true format: html: code-fold: true df-print: paged jupyter: python3 execute: echo: true --- ## 1Ô∏è‚É£ The State of AI-Powered Job Growth ### **1.1 AI's Impact on Different Industries** Artificial Intelligence (AI) is **reshaping industries**, leading to both job displacement and job creation. According to the **World Economic Forum (2024)**, AI will impact **85 million jobs** but simultaneously create **97 million new ones** [@weforum2024jobs]. ### **üìä Interactive Bar Chart: AI Job Impact by Industry** ::: {#5826b59f .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pandas as pd import plotly.express as px # Industry-wise job impact data data = { "Industry": ["Tech & Data Science", "Finance", "Manufacturing", "Retail & Customer Service", "Healthcare", "Marketing & Advertising"], "Jobs Created": [500000, 300000, 250000, 200000, 400000, 150000], "Jobs Lost": [50000, 150000, 300000, 500000, 50000, 80000] } df = pd.DataFrame(data) # Create interactive bar chart fig = px.bar( df, x="Industry", y=["Jobs Created", "Jobs Lost"], barmode="group", title="AI‚Äôs Impact on Job Growth vs. Loss by Industry", labels={ "Industry": "Industry", "value": "Number of Jobs", "variable": "Job Impact" }, color_discrete_sequence=px.colors.qualitative.Bold ) fig.update_layout( font=dict(family="Arial", size=14), title_font_size=20, plot_bgcolor="rgba(240,240,240,0.9)", paper_bgcolor="rgba(240,240,240,0.95)", legend_title_text="Job Category", xaxis=dict(showgrid=False), yaxis=dict(showgrid=True, gridcolor="lightgrey", zeroline=False) ) fig.update_traces(marker_line_width=1.5, marker_line_color='black') fig.show() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html} ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ‚úÖ **Finding**: AI is **not just eliminating jobs**‚Äîit is **reshaping job roles** and requiring **new skill sets** [@elgar2024growth]. --- ## 2Ô∏è‚É£ AI vs. Non-AI Career Salary Trends As AI becomes more integrated into industries, **AI-powered careers** offer significantly higher salaries than traditional jobs [@bizreport2024ai]. Below is a comparison of **AI vs. Non-AI salaries** in 2024. ### **üìà Interactive Table: AI vs. Non-AI Job Salaries** ::: {#b4e22e8e .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} import plotly.graph_objects as go import pandas as pd # Salary comparison data df_salary = pd.DataFrame({ "Job Role": ["Machine Learning Engineer", "Data Scientist", "AI Risk Analyst (Finance)", "Software Developer", "Mechanical Engineer", "Customer Service Rep"], "AI-Powered Career?": ["‚úÖ Yes", "‚úÖ Yes", "‚úÖ Yes", "‚ùå No", "‚ùå No", "‚ùå No"], "Average Salary (2024)": ["$140,000", "$125,000", "$118,000", "$95,000", "$85,000", "$45,000"] }) fig = go.Figure(data=[go.Table( header=dict(values=list(df_salary.columns), fill_color='paleturquoise', align='left'), cells=dict(values=[df_salary[col] for col in df_salary.columns], fill_color='lavender', align='left')) ]) fig.show() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ‚úÖ **Finding**: AI-powered careers **command higher salaries** than traditional roles, making AI skills essential for career advancement [@forbes2024future]. --- ## 3Ô∏è‚É£ AI Job Automation Risks: Who Is at Risk? AI is **automating repetitive tasks** across industries, putting millions of jobs at risk. Research from **ScienceDirect (2024)** shows that AI will impact several sectors **over the next five years** [@sciencedirect2024employment]. | **At-Risk Job Categories** | **Examples of Jobs AI is Replacing** | |------------------------------|-------------------------------------| | **Clerical Work** | Data entry clerks, secretaries | | **Retail & Banking** | Cashiers, bank tellers, call center agents | | **Manufacturing & Logistics** | Assembly line workers, warehouse packers | ‚úÖ **Finding**: The **job displacement risk** is highest for **repetitive, rule-based tasks**‚Äîbut AI-driven **reskilling can mitigate this risk** [@umass2024ats]. --- ## References ::: {#refs} ::: ## Skill Gap Analysis We compared our current team skills against the most in-demand job market skills for AI and analytics roles in 2024. | Skill | In Market Demand | Team Has It | |-------------------|------------------|-------------| | Python | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ | | Spark | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ | | AWS | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ | | TF-IDF/NLP | ‚úÖ | ‚ùå | | Power BI | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ | | SQL | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ | Our team is well-prepared for technical roles in data and AI, with strong coverage of cloud, analytics, and visualization tools. Future upskilling in NLP and advanced feature engineering is recommended. ## References - ONET Online. (2024). [https://www.onetonline.org/](https://www.onetonline.org/) - U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics. (2024). Occupational Outlook Handbook. - Lecture materials from AD688, Spring 2025. - Job dataset created for educational use in AD688 project.
